item.title: Active Mobile
item.description: I was bearish on making this concept a priority...but last week I was standing in line, waiting to get on a plane, and the lady in front of me was searching for running events on her blackberry. She actually took quite a bit of time to read the event description and scroll through the list. Now if she could have just hit a button that says "email me the link to this registration form"....hmmm....
item.author: Alan

item.author: Jason Aloia

item.title: Promote Assets like Teachstreet.com
item.description: Taking it one step further, it would be interesting to explore the Commission Junction model: the ED’s would deliver code that tracks registrations, and the referring source would get a lead gen fee from the event (and a % of the lead gen fee goes to Active). The affiliates would earn on a sliding scale based on referring traffic. So not only could folks tap into our API to build a kick-a** property around our assets, but they would be compensated for doing so by our customers. A lot of moving parts there…but could be a great point of differentiation when Orgs is selling to clients (and a great source of referring traffic for us).

item.title: Promote Assets like Teachstreet.com
item.description:
I like the idea. We’re focused on partnering for distribution, when encouraging / consulting EDs on how to promote their listings on 3rd parties might yield similar results. EDs are certainly motivated to do some promotional legwork. I think we should explore it.
Additionally, it’s beautifully executed – search, directory, reviews, social and photos.

item.title: Spread requests for assets across subdomains to speed page load
item.description: Another option would be to use a 3rd party content delivery network which could have several servers all over the country/world and would deliver assets from a location as close to you as possible.
